tool.name: BRAT_table_tool

param.name: proj_path
param.dialogReference: Path to the BRAT project folder created in Step 1.

param.name: seg_network
param.dialogReference: Select the segmented (300m) network you created in the preprocessing steps.

param.name: in_DEM
param.dialogReference: Select the DEM that you downloaded and created.

param.name: flow_acc
param.dialogReference: Select the flow accumulation raster. If this is not added, the data will be generated, which takes slightly longer.

param.name: coded_veg
param.dialogReference: Select the landfire EVT layer, making sure that the “VEG_CODE” field has been added and populated.

param.name: coded_hist
param.dialogReference: Select the landfire BPS layer, making sure that the “VEG_CODE” field has been added and populated.

param.name: valley_bottom
param.dialogReference: Select a valley bottom polygon that is associated with the input stream network. This input will be required for Step 6: Conservation and Restoration Model.

param.name: road
param.dialogReference: Select a feature class representing all roads within the study area. If your area has roads, this input will be required for Step 6: Conservation and Restoration Model.

param.name: railroad
param.dialogReference: Select a feature class representing all railroads within the study area. If your area has railroads, this input will be required for Step 6: Conservation and Restoration Model.

param.name: canal
param.dialogReference: Select a feature class representing all canals within the study area. This input will be required for Step 6: Conservation and Restoration Model.

param.name: landuse
param.dialogReference: Select the land use raster, making sure that the “LU_CODE” and “LUI_CLASS” fields have been added and populated. This input will be required for Step 6: Conservation and Restoration Model.

param.name: ownership
param.dialogReference: If you have land ownership shapefiles, add them here. These will be used to optionally segment the network by ownership, as well as add ownership attributes to streams.

param.name: perennial_network
param.dialogReference: A perennial network can be given to populate the IsPeren field. If a stream network is given here, only perennial streams are used to find multichannel sections of the stream network. This may make it easier to edit the output for the Braid Handler.

param.name: out_name
param.displayname: Name BRAT table output feature class
param.dialogReference: The output name for the BRAT Table Network.

param.name: description
param.displayname: Short description for run - less than 100 characters
param.dialogReference: Write a short (less than 100 characters, including spaces) description for the BRAT run to be included in the project XML file.

param.name: find_clusters
param.dialogReference: This option will create a ClusterID field and populate it. This field is used in the Braid Handler to modify drainage area values. By creating them in the BRAT table, the technician can modify clusters to fit with what they want the tool to do. This is an advanced editing option, and not necessary for most users.

param.name: should_segment_network
param.dialogReference: This option divides reaches based on the roads input. This can be useful if the user wants to compare the results of the model to field data collected from upstream and downstream of bridges. This is not necessary for most users, but can be useful.

param.name: segment_by_ownership
param.dialogReference: This option divides reaches based on the land ownership input. This is not necessary for most users, but can be useful.

param.name: is_verbose
param.dialogReference: This option enables ArcMap to provide messages for each step conducted by the tool, letting the user track progress as the tool runs.

tool.summary: Calculates, for each stream network segment, the attributes needed to trun the BRAT tools.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Calculates, for each stream network segment, the attributes needed to trun the BRAT tools.
